results.title: Is there life after death?
results.creator_credit: Ivo Burum, Helen Gaynor, Alfred Hospital and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Nurses”.
Nurses “was filmed by four nurses and their friends at the Alfred Hospital in Melbourne to capture the real life drama of nursing from a very different perspective…their own” Nurses are: Kerryn O’Rourke - Oncology. Trish Builic - Psychiatric (to the homeless). Jane Newham - Emergency. Cassie Steward - Theatre. Ep 4. With Christmas and the Millenium coming up there are conclusions and last comments. There are holidays taken, shopping to be done and religion and beliefs are reflected upon. Jane demystifies the bed pan. One of Kerryn’s patients has rapidly deteriorated. Cassie becomes a patient. And Trish gets frustrated at the outpouring of good will on Christmas day and wonders where it all goes for the rest of the year.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ivo Burum, Helen Gaynor, Alfred Hospital and ABC-TV (Australia)

results.title: Is there any room for me here?
results.brief_description: This black-and-white computer animation is based around the image of a sparsely furnished apartment at nighttime, using light and shade effects - of a subtlety and delicacy that recalls the brushstrokes in a Chinese ink drawing - to pick out the objects from the dark background. The austere beauty of the forms and movements is accentuated by the strains of a Bach cello suite.

results.title: Is the Governor necessary?
results.brief_description: An investigation of the history and functions of the office of the Governor-General. Compares this with other Commonwealth countries, and with the roles of the state governors.

results.title: Is smoking worth it?
results.creator_credit: Myron Solin and American Cancer Society
results.brief_description: Shows four teenagers discussing why they do or do not smoke. Presents factual evidence linking cigarette smoking with lung cancer. Discusses the difficulty of giving up the habit of smoking. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Is recycling a load of old rubbish?
results.brief_description: This film gives an overview of the garbage crisis in Australia, the direct result of prepackaging and disposals. Alternative methods of rubbish disposal are examined.

results.title: Is it working ?
results.creator_credit: Community Arts Board, Archival Film Project of the Australia Council and John Hughes
results.brief_description: Long before the idea of community arts became a popular and welcome activity, George Seelaf was organising participatory art activities for workers in factories. This film looks at the influence that George Seelaf has exerted through his commitment to labour movement ideals; his support for radical artists and writers and his pioneering work for community arts. Seelaf established the Trade Union Clinic and Research Centre, now known as the Western Region Community Health Centre in Melbourne’s western suburbs. Secretary of the Australasian Meat Industry employees Union for 25 years he refused to accept the Order of Australia bestowed upon him because John Kerr was officiating. Includes interviews with Wally Curran, Frank Hardy, Noel Counihan and Andrew Reeves.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Community Arts Board, Archival Film Project of the Australia Council and John Hughes

results.title: Is it wonderful to bath? (TEFC)
results.brief_description: One of two films based on the work of an eminent Hungarian paediatrician who is concerned with the mental health and well being of children deprived of parents and reared in institutions. Unscripted and filmed in the Loczy Institute the film shows how infants and young children enjoy their bath, if adults have the patience to cooperate with the child encouraging him to be independent. Commentary in English.

results.title: Is it hot in here?: a film about menopause
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, John Taylor, Jennifer Torrance, Haida Paul and Laura Alper
results.brief_description: With humor sometimes tinged with ruefulness, a group of women discusses menopause, sexuality, and how it feels to be aging in a society consecrated to youth. The film also examines how the medical profession is influenced by the pharmaceutical industry’s advertising, and underscores the need for women to become educated health consumers.
